page.title: 10 GRAUNT COURTS
page.content: Commander McDonald-Hall has lived at Graunt Courts since 1975. It is a very large and expensive house. There has been a house there since 1556. The name Graunt Courts has french origins. Many years ago monks used to stop there on pilgramages. In return for bed and food they did jobs around the house and garden. Some of the monks painted pictures on the walls and ceilings at Graunt Courts. When the Commander first came to Graunt Courts there was a restless spirit that haunted the house. So a vicar came to bless all the rooms. The Commander owns an Aerospace Company which makes fittings for aeroplanes. He has a helicopter which he uses for work and pleasure. He also has 4 vintage cars. He has made many improvements to the house.
